posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a job? Check out these positions posted to our community board:

  • Buddy Pegs is looking for a Retail Manager*
  • Thaden School has an open position for a Middle School Math Faculty member

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it HERE!

posts.title: U of A Architects Receive Recognition For Outstanding Projects
posts.content:
The Architect's Newspaper showcased several projects by architects out of the University of Arkansas' Fay Jones School of Architecture and Design,

  • Rising stars: The awarded projects included The Marygrove Early Education Center in Detroit, designed by Marlon Blackwell Architects, and The ARK: Rural Botanical Garden, designed by the UA Community Design Center.
  • Going places: Somewhere Studio, the practice of UA professors Jessica Colangelo and Charles Sharpless, earned an honorable mention for its focus on public space design.

Read the full TB&P article HERE.

posts.title: Opening Weekend For Arkansas Baseball
posts.content:
No. 8 Arkansas opens the 2023 season with a big challenge this weekend, taking on three Big 12 teams in the College Baseball Showdown. 

  • Big three: Arkansas will open against the Longhorns tonight at 7p, followed by No. 15 TCU on Saturday and No. 9 Oklahoma State Sunday afternoon. 
  • On the mound: The Razorbacks have been dealt a blow with the loss of starter Jaxon Wiggins but plan on leading with Hagen Smith, Will McEntire, and Hunter Hollan this opening weekend. 

Read more on the season opener HERE.

posts.title: Paddlesports Industry Leaders Unite In Bentonville
posts.content:
Leaders from the paddlesports industry came together in Bentonville last month to create a new national trade organization called The Paddlesports Trade Coalition. 

  • Get on board: The coalition's goal will be to expand paddlesports across North America by connecting industry leaders and addressing issues like access and sustainability.
  • Summitville: The summit was co-sponsored by the local tourism bureau Visit Bentonville and Runway Group, a holding company striving to make Northwest Arkansas a great place to live. 

Read more on the story HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Happy Friday! Whether your plans include postponed Valentine's dates or hitting the town with friends, we hope these ideas help spark some fun this weekend:

  • On stage: Get your dose of live music thanks to KUAF's list of great shows happening this weekend.
  • Eureka gras: Eureka Springs goes Mardi Gras this weekend, with a Masquerade Ball tonight, Feb 17, at 6p and a parade tomorrow, Feb 18, at 2p.
  • Mardi on: The Fayetteville Mardi Gras Parade celebrates its 30th anniversary this Saturday, Feb 18, at 2p.
  • Movie Jam: The Arkansas Black Music & Film Expo begins today, Feb 17, in Fayetteville, with multiple film screenings, followed by a day filled with music tomorrow, Feb 18.
  • At the theater: Fall in love at Walton Arts Center with Moulin Rouge: The Musical, showing multiple times this weekend.
  • Run inside: Arkansas Track hosts the Arkansas Qualifier today at 2p in the Randal Tyson Track Center. 

Have a great weekend, everyone!

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• For the Fans: Another Fan Giveaway! We're giving away a free $50 gift card for trendy children's clothing store Bear Hollow Kids in Bentonville to the first of our NWA Daily Fans to respond to this email!
  • The Little Mer-mom: Beyond A Step will host Mom Prom‚ÄìUnder the Sea, an 80's themed night of dancing and fun at the newly opened Blue Zoo in Rogers on Feb 25, giving awards for best hair, best dress, and best dance moves!*
  • Let Me Count The Ways: Join local artists and businesses Sunday, Feb 19, from 5-7p at TheateSquared for Celebrating Black Love, a free event filled with poetry, music, and happy hour specials on cocktails, mocktails, and appetizers.*
  • Milton's mountain: Coler Mountain Bike Preserve is reviving its Paradise Found 5K race on Jul 8, with only 300 spots available for interested runners.
  • Time to shine: Have what it takes to be a Walk-On? Razorback Football will host open tryouts for currently enrolled students on Wednesday, Mar 1, at the Fred W. Smith Football Center.
